tr.td: The source values for the assessment - for example a QuestionnaireResponse

description.value: Defines a patient's known problem, a diagnostic or antecedent that deserves attention.

short.value: The high-level group or category of the score - e.g. 'Risk score' or 'Pain score'
The code of the score that is being calculated.
The patient that this score refers to
The time period that the score refers to.
The date and time when the score was made available
The care provider that took the assessment
The interpretation of the result from the value. For example if value is 12, the interpretation can be 'elevated'
The body site to which the score applies, when applicable
The different ranges of the value

definition.value: The different ranges that the value can have, and corresponding evaluation (e.g. 0..10: normal; 11..20: elevated)

short.value: The source values for the assessment - for example a QuestionnaireResponse
